sentence.Network_en: Many hoped he would renew the country's atrophied political system.
sentence.Network_cn: 很多人都期望他能使该国萎靡的政治体系振作起来。

sentence.Network_en: Cells divide and renew as part of the human growth process.
sentence.Network_cn: 细胞不断地分裂更新，这是人体发育过程的一部分。

sentence.Network_en: People had to renew their motor vehicle registrations through the mail.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们必须以书信方式重新登记机动车辆。

entry.def: If you renew an activity, you begin it again.

example.ex: He renewed his attack on government policy towards Europe...
example.tran: 他重新开始对政府的欧洲政策进行抨击。

example.ex: He believes the peace talks will be renewed soon...
example.tran: 他相信和平谈判不久将会重新开始。

entry.def: If you renew a relationship with someone, you start it again after you have not seen them or have not been friendly with them for some time.

example.ex: When the two men met again after the war they renewed their friendship...
example.tran: 两个人在战争结束后再次见面时重归于好。

example.ex: In December 1989 Syria renewed diplomatic relations with Egypt.
example.tran: 1989年12月,叙利亚和埃及重新建立了外交关系。

entry.tran: 延长(执照、合同等)的有效期;使续签
entry.def: When you renew something such as a licence or a contract, you extend the period of time for which it is valid.

example.ex: Larry's landlord threatened not to renew his lease...
example.tran: 拉里的房东威胁说不跟他续租。

example.ex: The job was for a fixed term and the contract is not being renewed.
example.tran: 这个工作有固定期限，而且合同不能续签。

entry.tran: 使（受到损毁或丢失后)重获新生
entry.def: You can say that something is renewed when it grows again or is replaced after it has been destroyed or lost.

example.ex: ...a renewed interest in public transport systems.
example.tran: 对公交系统重新产生的兴趣

means.word_mean: 1. re-establish on a new, usually improved, basis or make new or like new;

sentences.sentence: "We renewed our friendship after a hiatus of twenty years"

means.word_mean: 2. cause to appear in a new form;

sentences.sentence: "the old product was reincarnated to appeal to a younger market"

auth_sentence.content: The Olympic Finn class is preparing to renew battle.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Olympic Finn class is preparing to renew battle.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Olympic Finn class is preparing to renew battle.

auth_sentence.content: Let us renew the true spirit of that day.
auth_sentence.res_content: Let us renew the true spirit of that day.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Let us renew the true spirit of that day.

auth_sentence.content: It would take time, but life would renew.
auth_sentence.res_content: It would take time, but life would renew.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It would take time, but life would renew.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 新的, 初见的, 更新的
stems_affixes.word_buile: new新的→adj.新的, 初见的, 更新的 adv.新近
new新的→adj.新的, 初见的, 更新的 adv.新近
new新的+s复数→很多新的在一起→新闻
re重新+new新的→v.[使]更新, 使恢复

Sentence.sentence: She wanted to renew her contact with the Peace Corps.
Sit under a tree, look at water, feel refreshed, ever so slightly renewed.
They have little time left to renew contact with their brothers and sisters.
The man is going to renew his membership in a fitness center.

Over the past two years, the figures on imports and exports seem not to signal a double-dip recession – a renewed decline in the broad level of economic activity in the United States – but an economic expansion.

means.word_mean: (使)复原; (使)更新; 赋予新的生命和活力

sentences.en: The most important thing is to renew your health.
sentences.cn: 最重要的是恢复你的健康。

sentences.en: The trees renew their foliage every year.
sentences.cn: 树木每年都重新长出叶子。

jushi.english: The wood panels on the doors have all been renewed.
jushi.chinese: 所有门上的木板全被更新了。

jushi.english: Two days later the enemy renewed their attack.
jushi.chinese: 两天之后,敌人又开始了新的攻击。
